articles.title: Xi Jinping says world faces 'peace or war', as Putin and Kim join him for military parade
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping oversaw China's largest-ever military parade in Beijing, marking the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II. He was joined by Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un in a display of unity. The event, which showcased advanced military hardware, was framed by Xi as a choice between 'peace or war' for the world.

articles.title: Appeals court blocks Trump from deporting Venezuelan migrants under Alien Enemies Act, finding 'no invasion'
articles.description: A U.S. federal appeals court has ruled against President Trump's use of the Alien Enemies Act of 1798 to deport Venezuelan migrants. The court found that the situation did not constitute an 'invasion or predatory incursion' as required by the 18th-century law. This decision is the latest in a series of legal challenges to the Trump administration's immigration policies.

articles.title: House Oversight Committee releases thousands of Epstein documents
articles.description: The U.S. House Oversight Committee has released a large collection of documents, totaling nearly 34,000 pages, related to the case of Jeffrey Epstein. The release includes interviews with Ghislaine Maxwell and videos from Epstein's Palm Beach home. This comes ahead of a House vote to formalize the committee's investigation into the matter.
